meanings.sent1: The students were preexcited for the field trip.
meanings.sent2: She always preexcites her audience with a captivating introduction.
meanings.sent3: The magician preexcited the crowd by hinting at his upcoming trick.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies preexcited her senses, making her eager to taste them.
meanings.sent5: The suspenseful music preexcited the atmosphere before the big reveal.

meanings.definition: To stimulate or arouse in advance.
meanings.sent1: The coach preexcited the team before the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The upcoming concert preexcited music lovers in the city.
meanings.sent3: The chef preexcited the diners by describing the delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: The news of the surprise party preexcited her, making her curious about the details.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting preexcited the emotions of the viewers.
